definition: enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand

sentences.english: Napoleon planned to strike a quick blow at his old enemy.
sentences.chinese: 拿破伦策划对他的宿敌实施迅雷不及掩耳的打击。

sentences.english: Almost immediately, several blamed traditional arch-enemy Pakistan.
sentences.chinese: 矛头几乎立刻就指向了印度的宿敌巴基斯坦。

sentences.english: As Dangdang's old enemy, no outstanding accounts in the domain name has never been cheaper.
sentences.chinese: 作为当当的宿敌，卓越在域名上从来就没占过便宜。

sentences.english: Censorship is history’s greatest enemy of art.
sentences.chinese: 审查制度是亘古之艺术宿敌。

sentences.english: In the meantime he had destroyed Phoenicia , the old rival of the Greek merchants.
sentences.chinese: 在此期间，他摧毁了腓尼基，该国是希腊商人的宿敌。

sentences.english: Trust not a new friend nor an old enemy.
sentences.chinese: 新友不可信，宿敌需提防。

definition: to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
enemy/foe/(in opera) sweetheart or destined love
lit. to meet face to face on a narrow path (idiom)/fig. enemies or rivals meet face to face
(literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
to meet/to run into (sb)/to get together (with sb)
